prob_desc_description: Let's call a positive integer $$$n$$$ ordinary if in the decimal notation all its digits are the same. For example, $$$1$$$, $$$2$$$ and $$$99$$$ are ordinary numbers, but $$$719$$$ and $$$2021$$$ are not ordinary numbers.For a given number $$$n$$$, find the number of ordinary numbers among the numbers from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$.
prob_desc_output_spec: For each test case output the number of ordinary numbers among numbers from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$.
prob_desc_input_spec: The first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$). Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow. Each test case is characterized by one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^9$$$).
